full_description: Software Developer (DevSecOps)Job Category:Information TechnologyMinimum Clearance Required to Start:SecretEmployee Type:RegularPercentage of Travel Required:NoneType of Travel:NoneJob Description:General DescriptionCACI's Agile Solution Factory (ASF) is looking for a Software Developer for the pipeline Automation (DevSecOps) team supporting a key CACI DoD program.ASF programs thrive in a culture of innovation and are constantly seeking individuals who can bring creative ideas to solve complex problems, both technical and procedural at the team and portfolio levels. The ability to be adaptable and to work constructively with a technically diverse and geographically separated team is crucial.We are looking for talented individual to join our technically diverse team responsible for Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment (CI/CD) and automated testing frameworks. Your willingness to develop CI/CD automated processes, learn, stay abreast of industry DevSecOps standards and apply innovations will contribute to this team. We are looking for a technical developer that recommends and applies creative ideas to solve complex CI/CD challenges, both technical and procedural. You will work as an integral part of an Agile Scrum team-a highly productive team of technical professionals who thrive on supporting the customer's mission and growth objectives through CI/CD automation opportunities. You will work in close collaboration with software developers on the CI/CD team, other product teams, shared services teams such as cybersecurity, and other stakeholders within agile methodologies to support and improve upon the automation of the software scanning, build process, and installation activities.Responsibilities:Serve as software developer delivering quality software code through the CI/CD pipeline automation development team. You will work closely with members of the development, test, operations, and other shared services teams to troubleshoot build breaks, enforce software quality standards, and communicate package installation steps to operations concerning both non-production and production environments. You will write tasks and tests related to a specific user story to ensure requirements are met within standards. You will estimate assigned work and report status and barriers at daily Scrum team sessions.
